intro: Sericocoma denudata, commonly known as the naked sericocoma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, while the flowers are small and yellowish. Sericocoma denudata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid conditions.
